comments:
While shutting down a target eclipse, I got the following error in the .log:

Log: Thu Aug 30 17:26:46 EDT 2001
2 org.eclipse.ui 2 Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: org.eclipse.ui.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Argument cannot be null
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:99)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindow.close(WorkbenchWindow.java:289)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.WindowManager.close(WindowManager.java:103)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$2.run(Workbench.java:100)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:758)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:393)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.busyClose(Workbench.java:98)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.access$4(Workbench.java:76)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$3.run(Workbench.java:157)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:98)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.close(Workbench.java:155)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.QuitAction.run(QuitAction.java:31)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetSelection(ActionContributionItem.java:407)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetEvent(ActionContributionItem.java:361)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.access$0(ActionContributionItem.java:352)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem$ActionListener.handleEvent(ActionContributionItem.java:47)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:51)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.notifyListeners(Widget.java:622)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:1277)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1087)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:675)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:658)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:815)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:285)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:498)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.UIMain.main(UIMain.java:52)


NOTES:

NE (08/30/01 5:41:39 PM)
	I was running the site example.
	The workspace was apparently saved OK.

DS (9/13/01 12:55:46 PM)
	At the time this PR was filed Veronika says that SWT included version 1.2 of
	BusyIndicator.  
	Here is the source.  Line 99 is indicated by the arrow.

static void clear(Display display) {
	int index = 0;
	while (index < displays.length) {
		if (displays[index] == display) break;    <<<<<<<<<<<<<<
		index++;
	}

	There is a contradiction here.  The stack trace indicates a problem in busyWhile, but line
	99 is in the clear method.  This method will only be called after the display is disposed.
	Display disposal happens in the Workbench.run method after everything else.

	Perhaps Nick had modified the code in some way.  I will confer.

NE (9/17/01 12:35:04 PM)
	No, I had no changes to SWT in my workspace.
	If I open BusyIndicator.java in my build 133 self-hosting workspace, line 99 is:
	try {
		runnable.run();
	} finally {		// <<<<<<<<<<<<<<< here
	...

	Neither this place nor the one above make sense though.  
	In the code I have, there is no throw of IllegalArgumentException.

DS (9/18/01 12:06:29 PM)
	The exception is probably being thrown by the runnable.  Within this runnable
	we execute busyClose, which saves the state of each perspective ( and each part )
	in the window and then closes all perspectives ( and each part ) in the window.
	The problem now is to identify which part / class generated the exception.

	The IllegalArgumentException(String text) constructor is referenced by the following
	org.eclipse.ui classes ..

		ContributionManager.insertAfter -->  "can't find ID"
		ContributionManager.insertBefore --> "can't find ID"
		ContributionManager.remove --> "can't find ID"
		ContributionManager.addToGroup --> "group not found:"
		ImageRegistry.put --> "ImageRegistry key already in use: " + key
		TextViewer.setVisibleRegion --> "TextViewer.error.invalid_visible_region_2"
		TextViewer.internalRevealRange --> "TextViewer.error.invalid_range"
		TextViewer.setDocument --> "TextViewer.error.invalid_range"
		StringConverter --> various places with different text.

	None of these seem related.
	A simple search for "Argument cannot" in eclipse ui yielded nothing. 

	I also unzipped the source for all of the plugins in core, jdt, pde, vcm
	and ui.  "Argument cannot be null" string is only defined in SWT.java
	as the error string for ERROR_NULL_ARGUMENT.  This constant is referenced in
	69 files within org.eclipse.swt and is typically thrown whenever the input to
	an SWT method is erroneously null. 

	Conclusion: somebody passed null to an SWT control method. There is no
	indication which method was called or who called it.  I think we must wait 
	until we have a reproduceable case.  

DS (9/18/01 1:44:26 PM)
	Deferring.  Moved to Open bucket.

Have not seen this in a long time, and we have no reproducable case.
Closing PR.
